p: Pieler et al. ( 2016) bound inactivated, concentrated, and diafiltered influenza A virus particles produced in MDCK cell suspension to magnetic sulfated cellulose microparticles (100–250 μm) and directly injected into mice for immunization and observed high anti-influenza A antibody responses and full protection against a lethal challenge with replication-competent influenza A virus, whereby 400-fold reduced number of influenza nucleoprotein gene copies in the lungs of mice immunized with antigen-loaded microparticles compared to mock-treated animals was estimated.
